website_summaries.verdict: A durable pick axe that can be used in all weather conditions thanks to its nonslip handle.
pros: Has a 5-pound forged steel head with an overall weight of 7.2 pounds
Ergonomic fiberglass handle (36 inches) turns tacky when it becomes wet, making it nonslip
Commercial-grade, heavy-duty axe for tough jobs around the house or job site
cons: Head is susceptible to chipping if used with larger rocks, so you may need to sharpen it regularly

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent tool
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product! I have terrible, decades long unkempt, clay soil. It is the bane of my existence! This pick has been a tremendous asset to my landscaping endeavors! I wish I had this item three years ago. It is not light weight, but I wouldn't want it to be. The weight helps move the dirt with an ease, I didn't imagine possible. I was able to dig up a pesky elm tree! (of which, I have MANY) It is, without doubt, my favorite purchase of the year! My only want for alteration, would, perhaps be, a longer handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great pick.  Even has a warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected great pick. The weight is as expected for a 5 lb head. Does great at hard clay and rocky soil I live in the TN mountains just North of Georgia so have both land types to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: jai

customer_reviews.title: Breaks through hard dirt easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was having trouble breaking up hard, dry earth for my garden. What took a long time to do with a shovel was was quick and efficient with this mattock. Product is well made. The head is solid with a good weight and the handle has a comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Zhao

customer_reviews.title: The blade is not wide.
customer_reviews.text: The blade is not anywhere near as wide as other brands. I could not know that aheada time from the photos & ad on Amazon. The add should have included a closeup view of a denoted measurement next to the blade so I would know to not buy this. Now I see why the seller didnt include such exhibit in the ad. The weight is the positive, because 5 Lb head is what ya need. I had bought a 2.5 Lb different brand with a normal wider head blade but 2.5 Lb felt too light to break through anything hard in the ground/soil.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than stated!  Actual weight is 7lbs. 8oz.
customer_reviews.text: Those extra pounds make a difference when you are 80 years old and not as strong as you once were. I am not sure that I can handle this pick. I need something lighter weight.
customer_reviews.author: ML Uthus

customer_reviews.title: Effective tool
customer_reviews.text: Good balance, broad blade could be a bit wider, but heavy enough to dig out roots, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Advocate at 307

customer_reviews.title: Very good pick.
customer_reviews.text: Super good quality. I love this pick. It's long and has a good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Will last longer than I will!!! highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Clarson

customer_reviews.title: Good 👍
customer_reviews.text: I used it to removed my trees and it big help to dig up roots.
customer_reviews.author: An pham

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It's forged so it isn't going to bend. Light enough but with enough heft to let the pick go deep. I have used it to help pry up a cemented in fence post, so it is sturdy. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: K. Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!  Light weight but heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed to dig a trench for the sprinklers. It’s heavy duty but not heavy weight. My 12 year old used it as well to break up some concrete. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ccinca33

customer_reviews.title: As durable as you could ever need.
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my shoulders, I had no problems at all tearing down into 18 inches of hardened clay and river rock for 14 feet long trench. The weight of the pickax is perfect! Light yet so strong.
customer_reviews.author: Eldred Schoonover

customer_reviews.title: Surdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy mattox which can work as an axe, a narrow trencher, or a digger.
customer_reviews.author: Dwightcr

customer_reviews.title: This is a very manly tool
customer_reviews.text: I never heard of this brand before. But this thing is a monster. It is big. It is solid. It is well built. The handle has an excellent tack to it and affords a great grip. If you need to tear up some hard soil, this tool will make short work of the task. And the best part, the polymer handle is such that it dampens the impacts so they are not all transmitted to your arms and shoulders. And here's a tip, get yourself a good quality set of leather gloves before you start using this.
customer_reviews.author: Tell It Like It Is

customer_reviews.title: We have a pick.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in a huge box and was terribly scratched. Not sure where that happened but I am guessing it was shipped that way. No matter, it is a pick so if not scratched on arrival, it will be scratched soon. Although it is big, it is not super heavy and was very easy to swing around and break the ground. As the description indicates, this is a heavy duty pick and it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: LizardLvr

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty pick
customer_reviews.text: This pick has a nice light weight yet strong handle and I do like the nono-slip surface on the handle. The pick head weighs in at 5lbs, both edges are nice and sharp. One side goes to a sharp point and the other side goes to a sharp blade 2.25 inches wide. This works great for cutting small trenches for irrigation pipe.
customer_reviews.author: robochick

customer_reviews.title: this is a pick!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, sturdy, pick. Yes it has a big chuck of steel on the end so it is not "lightweight" , but it is a pick. If it was light weight it would not work. Their is a reason they don't make them out of aluminium. You lift the pick and let it drop. Repeat till you have a trench. You can add some muscle on the down stroke if need. expect to be tried after a day of using.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Roby

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've owned only four Pick Axes in my life. They usually last a long time, and you don't go through them often. That said, I really didn't need one when I got this one, but what the heck. And now that I've used it a few times, the last to bust up a kitchen floor, I can honestly say this is my favorite Pick I've ever owned. The handle is actually comfy, and it is VERY sturdy. I also like the weight, neither too heavy or light. It sits right on the edge with good balance and heft. It is also holding up well, including busting up some cement. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Multi use tool
customer_reviews.text: Pick design is used for breaking and prying and is really strong. Adze is used for digging and cutting into the ground and I use this at home a lot. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: S.E. ENT.

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Handle
customer_reviews.text: Okay, what do you say about a pick axe? It works or it doesn't, right? Well, this axe has a comfortable, ergonomic grip. It is lightweight, but has power. It is built well; sturdy, and durable. I'm completely satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daria S.

product_meta.title: Hooyman Pick Mattock with Heavy Duty Forged Construction, Adze and Ergonomic Non-Slip Handle for Gardening, Hunting, Landscaping and Outdoor
product_meta.description: Hooyman is expanding the line of products into tools built for every aspect of land management. Each tool is designed with purpose to deliver the best performance for the task at hand. Hooyman tools are designed to be the strongest on the market with a modern aesthetic design with shelf appeal. Featuring the no-slip H-GRIP handle to deliver the most comfortable and secure grip on the market, these tools are truly unique.
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: 36 inches L x 21 inches W x 2.75 inches D and weighs 5 lbs
SPECS: 1045 high strength forged steel and an HRC of 45-60
RELIABLE: Features the new, no-slip, H-Grip on the ergonomic handle that turns tacky when wet to ensure a secure grip in all conditions
DURABLE: Handle is interlocked and epoxy sealed into the eye of the head and features a solid fiberglass core for added strength making quick work of ground breaking and root splitting
CONVENIENT: Head features a pick for breaking and prying as well as an adze for digging and cutting into the ground, making this the perfect addition to any garden or land management tool arsenal
GUARANTEED: This product is covered by a Limited Lifetime Warranty provided by Hooyman. For questions, please contact the manufacturer
